official-title.#text:
Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relating to the authority of
			 Congress and the States to regulate political campaign contributions and
			 expenditures, including independent expenditures.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following joint resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text:
That the following article is proposed as an amendment to the Constitution of the United States,
			 which shall be valid to all intents and purposes as part of the
			 Constitution when ratified by the legislatures of three-fourths of the
			 several States within seven years after the date of its submission for
			 ratification:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or any State from imposing
			 content-neutral limitations on contributions or expenditures which are
			 used to refer to a candidate for election for Federal office, including
			 contributions or expenditures which are made independently from a
			 candidate or a candidate’s campaign during such period as

or the
			 State may establish which is proximate to the date of the election in
			 which the candidate is running.

text.#text: Nothing in this Constitution shall be construed to prohibit
Nothing contained in this article shall be construed to abridge the freedom of the press.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HJ 121 IH: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relating to the authority of Congress and the States to regulate political campaign contributions and expenditures, including independent expenditures.
